intro.para: Here we introduce the quantities +\infty and -\infty, called (plus) infinity and minus infinity, to close off the number line. -\infty is to be less than every number, and +\infty is to be greater than every number.

We emphasize that the quantities -\infty,+\infty are not elements of \RNr, hence are not real numbers. Rather, we introduce these objects here for convenience and efficiency of thought and communication. – This section can be skipped on a first reading.
